body:
Ah I see :) I guess you'd just still allow the optional class to be passed
in case you wanted it to become say Child instead of Parent from SubChild?



On Wed, Jul 25, 2012 at 2:10 PM, Pete B <
reply@reply.github.com
> wrote:

> @brendon Not that you should, but it would work with as much inheritance
> as you can throw at it. Since only one of the classes can descend directly
> from ActiveRecord::Base, you could use:
>
> class Parent < ActiveRecord::Base; end
> class Child < Parent; end
> class SubChild < Child; end
>
> SubChild.base_class # => Parent
>
> ---
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/3023#issuecomment-7238874
>
